turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Jennifer?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: No it's mom.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Mom!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: We're worried about you. "60 Minutes" was on same-sex couples.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What does that have to do with me?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You haven't mentioned dating anyone since Mark and, well you're not a lesbian are you?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, I'm not a lesbian. Geez mom.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: It's okay if you are, we just want to know. I don't want to be expecting grandchildren if...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I have cramps. I can't believe I let you talk me into this.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Come on, we've been double dating since the fourth grade.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yeah even then look what happened: Michael Mortenson kissed you and Billy Sullivan threw a worm at me.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well that's not going to happen tonight. George said Carlton's a nice guy.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Translation: a total geek.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Anything's better than Mark.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: My shrink says he's not so bad.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Your shrink always gives you bad advice. He only hears what you choose to tell him. Mark's an asshole, he cheated, he borrowed money and never paid it back, he's never had a regular job.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: He's a very talented musician.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Every woman at some point has to date a musician. I wish you'd get rid of Mark for good. Every time you break up you see him more than when you were going out.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I guess I have a weakness for him. It's those big brown Bambi eyes.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So don't look in his eyes.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I wonder what it's like being you. Being noticed all the time.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: People notice you Frida.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: He hasn't said one word to me.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Maybe he's just shy.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: My date always pays more attention to you than to me.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, I don't mean this as a criticism, but you might not want to talk about PMS around men.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Sorry. It's just so bad lately. You're so lucky you never get PMS.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I get a little bloated sometimes.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'd kill for just a little bloated.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How about I give you a make-over? You'll feel better about yourself. You're actually pretty, you're just not bringing it out.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're just saying that.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Do you really need these?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Only to see.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Can't you get contacts?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, it grosses me out even thinking of putting something in my eye.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Try to get through dinner without them. You have beautiful eyes.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Or if there's a full moon.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Or if your boyfriend's an asshole.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Okay, just one more stop and you'll be all set. Victoria's Secret.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What do I need overpriced fancy underwear for? Shouldn't a guy have already decided that he likes me before he sees me in lingerie?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: It's not about him seeing you in it. It's how you feel. You'll feel sexy in lingerie and it'll show. It's an inner thing.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: There's a sale. It's such a nice place -- classical music, relaxing atmosphere. You deserve to pamper yourself. Come on, it can't hurt.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Where are all the mediums?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, grab that red one.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Can you believe she fuckin' bit me?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: And she got the medium.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Even on sale that stuff's a fortune. I worked all week to pay for a bra.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I think she broke the skin.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What a bitch. You should see a doctor. That can be dangerous. George bit me once and I had to go to the emergency room.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: George bit you?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I kind of asked him to. We were, you know... he got a little carried away...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Why did Gregory ask me out? I mean he's cute -- he probably just wants to pitch his screenplay idea.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Maybe he likes you, ever think of that? It's good for you to go out -- get your mind off Mark.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're so lucky you have George and don't need to go on dates anymore.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What I really hated about dating was the lines guys used to get into my apartment. "Can I use your phone?" "How about a nightcap?" "I want to meet your cat." And my all-time favorite, the old standby, "I have to use your bathroom."

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Maybe they have to pee.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Are you kidding? He might as well say, "Can I date rape you?"

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I never thought of it like that. I never know what to do on dates. Do guys still pay?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: They better. Of course, trouble is, you never know what they'll expect for it. You gotta know what to order, and what you're willing to do. Like if a guy spends a fortune on you, he's gonna feel like you owe him something.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Where? Where do you think a mustache would be. Look!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't see anything. Maybe just a little.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Holy shit, I'm a freak.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You are not Frida, we all have a little hair there. I didn't even notice till you showed me. We can bleach that, it's no big deal.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hey, did you get contacts?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh, my glasses! Maybe my eyes got stronger from not wearing them.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: He's dead? Am I bad luck or what?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: There you go, blaming yourself for everything again.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: And he was ripped limb from limb?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I'm sure they were exaggerating.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Why would they exaggerate?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: To sound like big macho cops. He was probably just found with a knife in his back.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So did you do it?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Did I kill him? Of course not!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No, did you fuck him?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. I don't think so.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You don't think so? You either did or your didn't.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I don't remember. We kissed at my door and next thing I knew I woke up with my period. Alone.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Did you get smashed or what? You have to eat if you're drinking. And not just those little salads.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I ate a burger in the afternoon and a steak and a half with Gregory.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I guess you're off that vegetarian kick you've been on for ten years.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I couldn't stop eating steak. I felt out of control -- like I was making up for all those years being a vegetarian. I couldn't get enough. And then Gregory walked me home... and he peed in front of me.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What? Why the hell did he do that?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: He was trying to get into my apartment and... I know this sounds gross but I was so turned on. I grabbed him and kissed him!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: And then?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I think I went in and fell asleep. I guess Gregory walked home and got killed! I blacked out.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: At least your PMS is over.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: And my bra finally fits again.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I thought you were going to stop wearing your glasses.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: My vision got worse again.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Are those Mark's?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, Mark wears boxers. They must have been in the dryer already.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Uh huh... good thing those cops didn't see that.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: He was cute, huh? Of course whenever I meet a guy, I'm wearing no make-up.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Rule one: always wear make-up.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I wonder if he's married.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He wasn't wearing a ring. But you don't want to date a cop Frida. They're so blue collar.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Gross, so this is Mark's flesh? When did you see him?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Um, he stopped by yesterday before you came over.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me? You said you hadn't seen him for a month.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm sorry. I didn't want you to think I was still a doormat.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, I'm your friend. I'm not judging you... You didn't sleep with the creep did you?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I don't think I've ever actually liked anyone I've dated before. Peter even likes me without makeup.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hmmm. Sounds suspicious.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I don't know much about him. How do you know if a guy is decent?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Give him the tampon test.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What the hell is the tampon test?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You're at his place, and you come out of the bathroom looking all shy and say, "I'm so embarrassed but could you run out and get me some tampons?" If he says no, he's too embarrassed, then you know he's a wus. If he says he's got some in the bathroom, then you know there are other women around a lot. But if he says yes and goes to get you tampons, well then he's a decent guy. Then, while he's out...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm freaking out. I'm like an animal and totally out of control. My arms keep getting really hairy.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You have to stop being so self- critical Frida.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I looked like an Italian man!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How'd it go with the cop?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: We almost slept together... and... then the hair started and I booked.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, this hair thing is all in your head. You're using it as an excuse not to get close to anyone.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: It's just as well. I'm afraid of getting hurt again. Mark seemed great at first too. I don't want to get too attached to Peter and then find out he's a creep.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hey, Carlton's in town -- come out with the three of us.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No he didn't. Come on, I don't want to be alone with those two. All they talk about is basketball and it bores the hell out of me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Okay. I guess so.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Great. George is meeting Carlton first for drinks. We can meet and go together. It'll be a blast.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I started out on that eye-of-newt diet the doctor gave me and wound up in the tub covered in chocolate.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well whatever it was, seems to have worked cause you look great.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're just saying that.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I think he called you beautiful.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh my god. I've never had that before. I've had guys say they want me to suck their dicks and gross stuff but no one's ever said "Hey there beautiful."

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Charming Carlton.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: It is so hot in here.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Bag means condom now? I can't keep up with the word "bag." It used to be "No, that's not my bag" -- meaning not my thing. But now "my bag" means "my fault."

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I still thought it was a purse.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You might want to tape your nipples down next time. It's really distracting.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I can't help it. My bra wouldn't even fit. I've been going to Victoria's Secret and exchanging bras for bigger ones and still I'm busting out. It's this PMS.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Geez, I wish I'd get it like that.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No you don't, believe me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh my god, look. My arms are so hairy!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No they're not.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yes they are! Look how much more hair I have than you!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: It's just cause mine is finer. A little bleach'll fix that.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I look like fuckin' Chewbacca.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, this is a bad time. We're having sex and George actually answered the phone.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: There is a man's arm in my bed.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Jennifer. A severed arm. It's bloody and... I'm not sure but it may be Carlton's.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You fucked Carlton? See I told you he liked you.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No! Not fucked him, I think I killed him.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Please come over. I'm begging you. What should I do with the arm? Should I call the cops or... Peter?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, you're not making sense. I can't come over right now.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So where's this infamous arm now?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I put it down the garbage disposal.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: And what makes you think you killed a man?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Because of PMS, I get hairy, my nails turn into claws, I eat raw meat, I roam the city hunting for flesh. I've become a werewolf!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You're a PMS werewolf. Of course. Frida, are you on drugs?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, last night I think I chased Carlton around as a wolf and killed him. I woke up with a taste of blood in my mouth and a severed arm in my bed. And my throat hurts.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You're delusional. Maybe you had a bad dream and bit your lip -- so you tasted blood. And the severed arm... well I don't see it and... maybe this is all in your head.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: It took me an hour to clean it up. That was not in my head!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Maybe the blood was from your period like before.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I haven't gotten it yet.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, listen to yourself. If I said I was a werewolf, would you believe me?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I don't know. You have to take Sammy. He's afraid of me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida? I was worried to death about you. I've called you for two days. Where have you been?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I've been here. What day is it?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Tuesday. Are you okay?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Shit, I guess I missed work.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida, Carlton's dead.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: And he was missing an arm.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh my god Jennifer. I should go to confession.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Relax. Carlton was torn apart. No way could you have done that. Maybe you saw someone kill him and blocked it out... or...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Get rid of him!

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Okay, I gotta go.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I'm stopping by later. I'm worried about you. Bye.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Holy shit, I don't know.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Did you get rid of Mark?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I don't know... I'm spaced out... he was taking a shower... He must be still in there.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He's been here all night?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yeah, I guess. Mark?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What happened to his tooth?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I should call the police. Oh no Peter. Peter is the police!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: DON'T call the police.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Why not? There's been a murder.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: First of all, you're my alibi. I told George I was with you last night.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What? Why'd you do that?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: There's kind of this guy I'm seeing.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're cheating on George? Jennifer, how could you?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How could I? I'm helping you clean up Mark's remains and you ask how could I cheat on George?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're right. It's just, I can't cover up a murder so George won't know you're cheating.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You say murder, but you have no idea what happened. You don't remember doing it, so it's out of your control.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I think I turned into a werewolf and killed him.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Why the fuck would you do that?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I could smell another woman on him.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: If you ask me, the fucker got what he deserved. I'm glad he's dead.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: That's a terrible thing to say. Frida goes back to scrubbing the floor.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Okay, let's say that this is PMS- related. You think those male cops are going to understand that? You'll either be locked up for murder or locked up in the looney bin. We have to keep this hidden until we figure it out ourselves.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: At least I finally saw the reason you couldn't get over Mark.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You should have seen it erect.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You expecting someone?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Ignore it.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Fuck it's the cops. Peter saw me, now I have to let him in.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Tell them you'll meet them outside.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What the fuck are we going to do?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hide him.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Peter knows something.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well if he does, he didn't give you away. He must really like you.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I think I just got my period.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Does that mean this whole thing is over?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Probably for three weeks or so anyway. I'm not sure -- I don't get how it works.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Let's do some research. I'll check the libraries. You surf the web.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're such a good friend.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So are you. Look, go about your life. Act like nothing's wrong. We'll get to the bottom of this.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Symptoms include loss of emotional control, compulsive behavior, cravings, crying spells...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Peter keeps asking me out.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Maybe you should go out with him. If you keep avoiding him he'll get suspicious. Besides, what better way to not get busted than to date the cop who's investigating you.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: The thing is, I really like him. I finally meet a guy I really like and I'm a fuckin' werewolf.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: We don't know you're a werewolf. It might never happen again. You have to get on with your life.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: "Paranoia, insecurity, depression, changes in vision, feelings of losing control; belief that you have a mental problem..." Nothing about turning into a werewolf.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Check out what I found.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: This is from a scientist in France, Madame Sconce. "The original werewolves were females. They became werewolves on the lunar cycle because it corresponded to the woman's cycle. My suspicion is that the only cure is true love."

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Great so all I have to do is fall in love? Like I haven't tried that for the past 24 years.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: "The female-cycle werewolf will only kill men and never kills someone she truly loves." See I knew you never loved Mark.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Who is this Madame Sconce? Let's find her and talk to her.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: She died at age 34 in the 1800's. They thought she was crazy. She was banished from her town. Seems her husband shot her.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Guess she never found true love.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: The weird thing is... he shot her with a silver bullet.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: So... she was a werewolf. Do you think we can believe all this?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What choice do we have?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: So what do I do?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Fall in love.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I think I already have.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm cleaning my stove.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You scared the shit out of me. I thought you were killing yourself.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I tried to kill myself -- earlier. It doesn't work. I think I need silver bullets. So I got depressed and when I'm depressed I clean.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You'll get through this. You were fine for over three weeks.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm just afraid I'll hurt Peter. I think I love him.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Remember what Madame Sconce said. If you love him he'll be fine.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: But how do I know if I really love Peter? And if he really loves me?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I guess you'll find out.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. I can't take that chance. I'd rather kill myself.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No. I won't let you do that.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: The werewolf always dies at the end. Didn't you see "American Werewolf in London?"

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I think George knows.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: About Mark? Carlton?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: About Benito.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Did I kill a guy named Benito?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No, he's the guy I'm having an affair with.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I thought you and George were getting married.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: We were -- I was just so tempted... It was sort of a test. I think after sleeping with Benito I know I want to be with George. But now George knows about Benito and he doesn't want to be with me!

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I wish I only had your problems.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Sorry -- I shouldn't go on about myself at a time like this. Are you sure you're going to be okay?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yes, just check on me once a day for the next three days. Then the PMS should be over.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Frida? You okay?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Never been better. Peter spent the night. I must really love him. He's still alive.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh thank god. Maybe this whole thing is really over.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: God I hope so. Hey can I call you later? Peter's still here. He's in the shower.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Sure. See ya.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: So you're Grant's secretary?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I do development for TV movies.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Oh, a D-Girl. You know... I have a really great idea for a screenplay.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're kidding, really?

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: No, I'm serious. How about we have dinner and I tell you about it?

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: You hungry?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Starving.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Man I'm starving too, I think I'll go for the Surf and Turf.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm not really hungry after all.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: You said you're starving. Come on, I can't stand a woman who won't eat.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: So there I was, hanging from the edge of a bridge, when my mom said, "Son, you got into Harvard!" It took three of them to pull me back! Frida keeps eating.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Well, whattdaya think?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: That's great. Highly original.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'd really feel more comfortable paying for my half of the dinner.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Hey, how about a little nightcap?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm really tired.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Come on, didn't all that steak make you thirsty?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. Really, I'm... I don't feel well. I've got terrible PMS.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: They say sex is great for cramps.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Well I have it worse than cramps. Goodnight Gregory.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: I really gotta pee.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You should have gone at the restaurant.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: I didn't have to pee then.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: My apartment's just such a mess.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: That's okay. I just have to use the bathroom and then I'll leave.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh come on. Knock it off.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Knock what off?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You don't have to pee.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Yes I do have to pee!

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You're just saying that to get into my apartment and then you're hoping that'll turn into something else.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: I wouldn't mind doin' something else, but I do really have to pee.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Uh huh. So pee.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: So pee? Here?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yeah. Whip it out. You want me to see it -- that's what this is all about, right?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: What, you got a date or somethin'?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Since when do you care?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You look different. I mean you look good.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You never say that.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You do though. You look really... is that a wonderbra?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Look what you did!

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh my god, I'm sorry!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Shit. And you're eating my burger? You don't eat meat.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I can't help it, it smells so good.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: OUCH that stings! Damn, what am I going to do with my back like this?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Worried about what all your girlfriends might think?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Frida, you know you're it for me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yeah right... You better go.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Hey wait, I paid three bucks for that burger. You owe me...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You haven't even paid me back the thousand bucks you owe me!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I'm working on it...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Where'd you get the bike?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I'm kinda borrowing it. Who's this, Mr. Date-Guy?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Frida? I hear you talking. I know you're in there. Let me in.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: It's Mark.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: It's a matter of life and death.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: This really isn't a good time.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Come on Frida, I'm not kidding. I'm totally fucked. Let me in.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I did something stupid. I had a courier job -- picking up a package from the airport. It turned out to be money -- so I kind of borrowed it to pay my rent and now these dudes are after me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: So pay them back and apologize.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: These guys aren't the kind that'll take an apology. They're the kind that'll break my thumbs.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You think that story's gonna make me loan you money?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: It's the truth. If you'd just loaned me the money last time this never would have happened.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Somehow this winds up being my fault? You always blame me.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Come on, I'm your biggest supporter.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: My bra is my biggest supporter.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I just need a place to lay low for a few days. Come on, I know you hate me but you can't wanna see me at the bottom of the East River?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Mark.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Take your shower.

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: The Nielson's?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: On your desk.

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: Script coverage?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: On your desk.

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: Coffee and...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Your desk.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: How about a "Man in Jeopardy" story?

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: Did you change your hair?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: A little.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I can't read any more crap. These women are all victims.

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: Yes, that's what we're looking for.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I think we should do something with strong female characters...

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: I'll make a note of that. Put the coverage on my desk.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Mr. Grant. Did you read that script I was talking about?

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: Uh... yes. Not for us. No woman in jeopardy. Find me Dr. Quinn Medicine Woman. Find me a true story about a crazed killer stalking beautiful women.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. I quit. Take your lame ass ideas, your fake ass toupee, your fat ass wife and your ugly ass kids and shove them.

turns.speaker: MR. GRANT
turns.text: Very well then. Is that all?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: When's the last time you saw him?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: We... he walked me home and... we said goodnight. Um, he kissed me goodnight and that was it.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I wish I could help but last I saw Gregory was outside my front door.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay, if you think of anything else, please give us a call.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You busted me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Are you following me?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No... no... this is embarrassing. I was returning your pillowcase... and I saw you cross the street... and I sort of started following you. I just find you really intriguing. I don't know why.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Intriguing?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I gotta get going. Peter gets the pillowcase out of his bag.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: At least let me give you this back. I washed it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Being a cop has such a warm effect on people.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: That's my ex. He's an asshole. In case you couldn't tell. I think he's been following me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: There's a lot of that going around.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You wanna get some coffee?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm trying to stay away from caffeine.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Some decaf then? That was stupid. Obviously you said you were staying away from caffeine as a nice way of blowing me off.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. Really. I don't drink coffee anymore. I used to love it but my tastes have changed recently.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay well. Maybe some other time. They continue walking together.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So what book did you buy?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh, it's nothing.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No really, I love knowing what people read.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: It's stupid.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I can forgive you a bestseller.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: My mom used to get PMS too.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Used to? Did it stop finally?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No, she died when I was twelve.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I've had time to get over it. She was killed by wolves they think.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh my god, by wolves?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We lived in northern Minnesota. She went for a walk one night and they never found her body -- just her torn apart clothes with her blood and wolf blood on them. Then the town rounded up bunch of hunters and shot all the wolves in the area.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm so sorry Peter. Gee, that sure puts my problems in perspective.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The weird thing is I've had an odd, morbid fascination with wolves ever since.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I've read scripts about detectives, but never met one. Must be wild.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Sometimes it's frustrating. Like this Gregory Jameson case. We don't even know what killed him. I'm putting together little details to see if we're missing something.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You know how moms always tell you to wear clean underwear in case you're in an accident? Well this guy wasn't wearing any underwear.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: A lot of people don't wear underwear.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah but a guy hung like a horse would need briefs to keep things in line.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: How about you? Briefs or boxers?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Briefs.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Cool. I don't get guys who wear boxers. My ex wore boxers. I never got how he could wear khakis and not have his boxers bunch up.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Me neither. That's why I wear briefs... So why did you and... Mark break up?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: He's bad news. He cheated on me, he insults me. Now suddenly he gets jealous if I have a date.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I really gotta get going.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Thanks for the walk. Maybe we could... get a bite sometime?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yeah. Maybe.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What are those?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Silver bullets. A collectors item. These are very valuable. They were melted down from a crucifix.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What are they for?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh just my wolf paraphernalia. Some people collect beanie babies... I collect silver bullets.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm a cop -- I notice everything. That drawer's ajar, that picture's been moved about an inch, the closet wasn't closed when I left...

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Okay, you busted me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, nothing's wrong. Just... well don't you have your period?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: My period? No.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I mean we can still... whatever... Maybe I should get a towel?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. No, I'm fine. Maybe I should go. I mean... I don't want our first time to be like this.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Frida, wait. Don't go. We can just sleep. I just want to wake up with you.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh my god, you scared the shit out of me. You following me again?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No. I was doing my laundry.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm sorry -- I'm on edge today.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Was there anything in that washer?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. Nope, nothing in it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You sure? It's my favorite shirt, mind if I check?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: NO! I... I checked when I put my stuff in. I always look through the washer first.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Everything okay?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: A man killed in Central Park.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Uh.... hi!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Frida, can we come in? We need to talk to you. It's important.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Uh... the buzzer's broken. I'll be down in a second.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You had a date with Carlton?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: It wasn't a date. Jennifer invited me along to dinner with them.
